hackathon-description-text: DragonHacks 2017 is 24-hour hardware and software hackathon at Drexel University.
hackathon-rules: You must adhere to the MLH Code of Conduct. https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each team member gets to choose a prize from our prize selection!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3141 Chestnut St, Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The project has a clear problem statement and indicates how the project will solve it.
The originality of an idea will also be considered during judging. If something similar exists it must differentiate from it in some way that makes sense.

This criteria considers how much of the project is original work completed during the hackathon compared to building on existing libraries, projects, etc. It also includes how polished and well implemented the project is.

This criteria is based on the team's ability to articulate the problem they are trying to solve and their solution to it. It also takes into account the team's ability to discuss the technical aspects of the project.

hackathon-description-header: Create amazing projects at the best 24-hour software and hardware hackathon.
